intro: Schistogyne pubescens, commonly known as the hairy schistogyne, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Schistogyne pubescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
